Reviews.Title: “New Lobby”
Reviews.Author: rositala1
Reviews.Content: Helpful and friendly front desk including wait staff in restaurant. Food amd menu could be updated. Only eat there under last resort. It is centrally located with easy access to highways. We have stayed the for years and will continue to go ba k. Great meeting rooms. Perfect busines hotel which is their focus.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for your business meeting”
Reviews.Author: djess55555
Reviews.Content: I presented a seminar here over two days. The banquet people were reliable and efficient, especially Javier who served our group. I did no touring, but the location doesn't seem that great for tourists. On the other hand, if you are going to hang around the hotel 90% of the time, as most people do when they come for business events, this hotel is a good choice. There are not a lot of restaurant options nearby, but you can walk to a Stuart Andersons or to Fiiippi's Pizza, which serves o.k. Italian meals (the manicotti was heavy, but there was a lot of it). The restaurant in the hotel serves an excellent breakfast buffet. I had one dinner in the hotel via room service, however, and the salmon was overcooked, but I've found that most hotel chefs overcook salmon. The wine list is surprisingly good and the bar and poolside are pleasant places to consume the wine. One evening there was a wretched smell in the third floor hallway. It may just have been the result of a guest who had gas, but it imbued the entire floor. The engineer who was sent up to deal with it could not smell it . . . but I had to hurry him away because the odor from the hall was beginning to inundate my room while I held the door open to talk to him. I'm not usually bothered by smells. I have no idea what it was. Probably just a one-time thing.

Reviews.Title: “The best service”
Reviews.Author: LindaPMac
Reviews.Content: When the electricity went out in all of San Diego, the on site chef provided dinner (bbq) for all the guests. Then everyone with a room was provided with candles (inside of glass holders) to take to their rooms for the night. The manager is always on hand in the evening to answer questions. A wine and beer reception provide an opportunity to mingle in the lobby. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed and are kept well cleaned. The customer service folks at the reception desk are ready and willing to answer any question and help in any way they can.. Our office is about 1/4 mile from the hotel and whenever we have groups staying they provide shuttle service to and from the office. When it seems there are no more rooms available, they seem to always find a room. The service is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and surprisingly nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ppbcup
Reviews.Content: I used to work at the business that shares the parking lot with this hotel many years ago before I moved out of the area. I had been to the hotel for work related lunches, meetings, and other events so I was familiar with the lounge and the restaurant. I was coming to San Diego to visit friends and compared to other hotels; this was a great option. The rates were reasonable, free parking and centrally located. I was really caught off guard by how great this place was! The service from every employee we encoutered was excellent! Everyone was nice and helpful and smiled. The actually hotel looks like it has gone through upgrades. The thing is that with some hotels, even Marriott is guilty of this, you can tell they bought new carpet or painted but other were not upgraded. Every detail from floor to ceiling seemed new. If you are visiting San Diego and have a rental car I would recommend staying here over any hotel in Hotel Circle. As I mentioned, parking is free! It located off of the 163 minutes away from Mission Valley and 10 minutes from Balboa Park, the Zoo, Sea World, Hillcrest and downtown. Also hotels in Hotel Circle tend to be a little worn so this would be a nice luxury. Since it is near a business park it lends itself to be quieter too. If you are looking for night life near by this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: fa11man
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property for 3 days for intensive meetings. The room for the meeting was comfortable and clean, and the staff was phenomenal in their support of us. Attentive, professional, and always cheerful. We'll come back when we're in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in San Diego for School”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: Recently, I had the pleasure of staying at the Courtyard San Diego for a class. I arrived on Super Bowl Sunday the game was on and the Hotel had a great special on food and drinks. The staff was very helpful throughout the week. My room was kept very clean. The facilities are great. I was able to work out in the onsite gym every other day and there was more than enough equipment. The hotel is a short distance away from several outstanding restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: zmefferd
Reviews.Content: Being away from home and the ones you love for nearly a month isn't most peoples idea of a good time. I for one was non too please about the idea. However after my experience in this hotel, I must say if I ever had to spend that much time away from home again, I couldn't think of a better place to stay. The facility was very nice, but what really impressed me most was the staff. This is not to say everything was perfect during my stay, but no matter what happened all my issues were resolved quickly, and with courtesy. Furthermore I never once saw anyone not smile or offer to assist me in anything I needed. Again I was very impressed with Ben, Don, Gemma, Alina, Cesar, Deborah, Corina, Emory, Latoya, Chris, Francisco, and Frankie who are just a few of the names that I could remember, and of course there were more.

Reviews.Title: “Centralized Location and Professional Service”
Reviews.Author: Shaney G
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in February, Room 321 Pros: Location, with easy access to all freeways; Professional service in all departments; useful amenities and modern & updated decor Cons: You need a car, because restaurants and stores are about a 20-30 minute walk. With the Courtyard brand geared to the business traveler, my wife and I rarely stay at a Courtyard, but stayed at this hotel because of close proximity to our daughter. We were thoroughly impressed by the professional staff and modern decor. We really like the Lobby Lounge area, where you can sit down and enjoy a drink (adult beverage or Starbucks) or other quiet areas where you can conduct business. The rooms were comfortable with sitting areas and a large flat screen television. The Breakfast Buffet in the Gazebo Grill restaurant was filling and tasty. On our next trip to this area, we will definitely be staying at this Courtyard again, as well as recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard SD Central - great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: tknogeek
Reviews.Content: I stay here often because it's between downtown and Rancho Bernardo where I work. The location really works because it's easy to hop on the 163, 8, or 805 to get where I need to go. Downtown is 15-20 minutes away. The Mission Valley/Fashion Valley area is 10 minutes away. The hotel is squeaky clean and the staff always takes great care of me no matter what weird problem or request I have.

Reviews.Title: “Outperforming the Courtyard high standard :)”
Reviews.Author: rob n
Reviews.Content: Very good service, super nice bed (as always), really clean room (and rest of the hotel) and also a pleasant hotel bar with good choice of drinks etc

Reviews.Title: “Home to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Bev L
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Courtyard by Marriott Central. It was a great choice for so many reasons. The staff are all so friendly and went out their way to make me feel welcome. Access was perfect, close to the freeway, but no noise. The lobby computers made it easy to check my email, the pool was quiet and beautifully maintained, a great place to sit in the sun. My room was so comfortable, well appointed and completely 'tech' up to date. I stay in lots of hotels and my room was so quiet, housekeeping was amazing, my room seemed to be magically cleaned every day. My room was quiet, I slept in as many days as time allowed, the bed was very comfortable. I simply could not have asked for anything more. I will stay here again when I am lucky enough to go home to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not central to tourist attractions, but good for business”
Reviews.Author: pickyreno
Reviews.Content: If you thought central meant near zoo, sea world, gas lamp, nope... This is near businesses like Sharp. Big lobby, easily distracted night receptionist. Generous size rooms. Outdoor pool not heated well enough for my use. Platinum marriott members get no extra warmth or services, points at check in or amenity as usual is offered. Quiet. Costs more than other hotels in area. $175/n

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bed!”
Reviews.Author: Wallaan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and well furnished. I flew into San Diego for a business meeting and needed a good night sleep for a long day. I couldn't have checked into a better hotel for that. I have stayed in maybe 200 hotels during my life and this was the most comfortable bed ever. To top it off, they gave me a 2:30 late checkout, so I was able to attend my early morning meeting and then come back and take a nap before heading back to the airport. If I visit San Diego again, I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: AGinLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the Saturday night before the AFC half marathon in August 2011. Great service from the staff, everyone was so friendly and helpful. Room was clean and modern as was the hotel itself. Actually really liked the bath products they provided. Room had a nice couch and working area, flat screen TV, and fairly comfy bed. Note to ladies: the hair dryer is in the closet. Took me a minute to find it. Bar and lounge area was nice -- our group hung out for a bit and had drinks and watched baseball on the TVs in the lounge at night. We spent the afternoon at the pool resting up for the race. Pool was a decent size and there was a huge fireplace and outdoor seating if you want to have drinks out there at night. The bar had fruit infused water (cucumber and orange) in large pitchers which was refreshing while we were at the pool. They also have free coffee at the bar 24/7. They provided a free shuttle to the race and a to-go breakfast for the runners. They also had a pasta dinner the night before for $10 which was decent and convenient. Would most definitely stay here again next year. Location is great, with easy access to multiple freeways. Parking was plentiful even though they were at capacity because of the race and some other event that was happening. And we got a really great price being part of the race as well. Glad we chose this spot! Foodie note: there's a really yummy Mexican food spot called Gallegos #2 in a little plaza about a mile down the street. Amazing breakfast burritos and tacos!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Sbain76
Reviews.Content: I would have ranked this hotel higher than 3 overall normally. Positives: location is great, facility is dated but clean, and staff seemed-responsive overall. Negatives: dated, any kind of food is over priced, and they don't have a 24 HR front desk. I walked out to my car without my room key and walked around the building to the front desk around 2 am. No front desk, rang the buzzer multiple times, then used my cell to call my wife and she came down and let me in. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great property with not a lot around it”
Reviews.Author: StephanieRose
Reviews.Content: This is a great property! Beautiful and comfortable rooms, free parking and ample space, on site dining, workout and pool facilities, etc. My only complaint is that I wasn't impressed with dining options near the hotel. Be prepared to drive to any attractions, shopping, or dining. I did find the onsite dining to be good and priced reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel Destination”
Reviews.Author: FromVegas
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 21 nights in 7 different rooms in the last year. We've been working with a company in the area. Somehow I've never found the time to write a review but we reached several milestones and our frequent stays are coming to an end. Of about six hotels we've stayed at during the last year, this is probably my favorite hotel in the area. The highlights are: - Beds: As in all Courtyards I find myself getting great sleep (after the first night where I never seem to sleep well away from home). - Pool: An Olympic outdoor pool. It's heated (I hope they use waste heat from some other hotel mechanicals because it probably would cost a fortune with electricity or gas), It's clean, It's almost always empty. Next to it is a spa which I've always been happy with. he spa has the usual chlorine levels but a quick swim after loosening up the muscles fixes that. - Workout room: clean, large in size and well equipped (never have had to wait for equipment during my 6:00 workouts) - Lobby: comfortable places to sit and meet up with your colleagues, clean restrooms, easy access to lounge, dining, and conference areas. Complementary coffee in the morning is pretty good. - Managers Special: (drum roll) Wednesday at 5:00 PM there is a managers special. They bring out a dozen or so bottles of wine and three or so cases of beer. Also they bring out appetizers (this last week it was BBQ meatballs and a great vegetable tray and then calamari when the meatballs ran out). Max the GM wanders about chatting with the clientele. Nice guy who has helped us get a room when rates are above per diam. There are some things I think need to be worked on: - Elevator floors: I use the elevators exactly twice, once on arrival and once on leaving, because I use the stairs as much as possible. But my co-travelers comment repeatedly on the elevators and especially the dirty floors. - Drink prices: Marriotts have never been a place to drink. Don the bar tender is great but I can't charge alcohol against travel so I have to pick up the charge. I had one drink each of three nights and bought two for my fellow traveler and it cost me just about $35. Given it is a pleasant place to have a cocktail and you don't have to drive but I think they might be pushing people to drink in their room that they might be missing out on sales of those delicious bar snacks (try the cross-cut fries with bleu cheese). Of course Marriotts no doubt runs this all through computer models and has optimized the profit which I embrace but maybe I'm not normal. - Some rooms are noisy: I don't typically have this problem because I'll ask to be away from elevators and ice machines. The only reason to stay near noise is to avoid the dreaded handicapped rooms (I don't need enough room to dance in the bathroom and rails to get off the toilet are totally unnecessary thank you). Other things: - In room: Tea and Coffee provided but if you are a tea fan you want to run several clean pots through the coffee maker or the flavor will suffer. Love the towels. Shampoo, conditioner, soap, and lotion are of good quality. There always seem to be some trivial stuff that is wrong (I got broken soap this trip, one shower curtain hoop was not connected). The 35 or so channels of LCD TV is excellent except they need to program the channel banners because a ESPN banners are on not only their channels but on others (room 188 had this problem on this trip but I've seen it on others). Grout is free of creepy stuff and foot fungus. The couch in this room had an obvious droop but I slipped a couple of inches over and TV viewing was comfortable. Carpet was clean. Drapes allowed you to sleep into the daylight without light bleeding into your room. Biggest complaint was that my mini-refrigerator froze everything and I could not find an adjustment to fix the problem. - Parking: Some of the places directly in front of the hotel are tight. But parking is free and there are probably about two acres. I don't like the fact that they have planters with bushes that don't allow you to walk to the building without dragging your bags over those obsticles - Breakfast: Great but I just have problems with $12 for a breakfast buffet. I'd always eat there if they had a nice bowl of fruit or yogurt over cereal for about half that price. I like to walk in the mornings so I usually walk to the north (to the left if you go out the front door). There is a Subway Sandwich shop 1/3 mile away that has good coffee and with a sandwich will cost $3. What is but can't be changed: Location: What can you say... I wouldn't stay there for personal travel. It's five or six miles to the stuff I do when not on business travel.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't even know it was here!”
Reviews.Author: poohchk25
Reviews.Content: When my bf booked this hotel for our stay in San Diego, I was a little hesitant. I lived in SD when I was going to college and never really a remembered a hotel in this area. Once we drove up to the location, I was in for a nice surprise. The hotel is centrally located (hence the name) in SD in an area known as Kearny Mesa. It's minutes from good food and about 15 minutes from Downtown. It's a great place to stay if you're looking for something reasonably priced and great amenities. My bf loves that they offer cucumber and orange water in the lobby. The room had a king sized bed, sofa with pull-out bed, a fridge, and swiveling flat panel tv. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Even at 12am when I needed a razor, they had one quickly sent up. We booked this room through priceline and for $80 butcks, it's a really affordable place to stay in SD. Free wi-fi and no cost parking on top of everything will guarantee us coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: grndzlm
Reviews.Content: The staff is helpful and friendly. The hotel is located in a business district. We stayed here to attend a wedding in Old Town San Diego, which is only a few miles away. Pros: Clean, good customer service, laundry services, nice pool, free parking and free wifi Cons: Just can't walk out of your hotel and explore the city- if you want to do that, stay in Gaslamp district. No microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean, very nice ammenities, would return.”
Reviews.Author: Aquafam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Labor Day weekend with my wife and two teenage daughters. Upsides: Very clean room, remodeled with huge and very nice lobby area. Free wifi and parking. Great breakfast with good coffee. Much lower rates than similar class hotels in the area. Very happy with the value. My wife and I spent the evenings by the fireplace (outside). Also, hotel was fully booked with LOTS of girls' soccer teams that were quite loud, but we never heard a thing in our room. Downsides: Small parking spaces-got a door ding! We stayed on the top floor (4th I think) and found elevator to be ridiculously slow. We chose the stairs every time. Location was a bit of bummer since most of the activities we enjoy are downtown. It's actually a short drive to the gaslamp (maybe 15 minutes), but we prefer staying downtown, however, the rates in the nice hotels downtown are about double what we payed here so the 15 minute drive was worth it. We travel to San Diego several times a year and in the future we will return to this hotel any time we don't feel like paying the high rates downtown or on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and would love to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy m
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They made our stay stress free. When I was checking in a young boy came into the lobby and had gotten too hot outside. The front desk staff immediately got him water and cold towels and took great care of him. The hotel was very clean and modern with a beautiful pool and patio with a fireplace. We stayed in a king suite that was the perfect size with 2 t.v.s. and more than enough space. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a Marriots affiliate - disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PandaLover63
Reviews.Content: The location was decent, close to freeway 163 and Claremont Mesa area. The front desk clerk (Kevin) I had was brain dead, I prepaid it through Travelocity and when I checked in and gave him my Target Visa (yes, Target does issue Visa cards) for incidental charges, he said "Oh, it's a Target card!" I had to tell him to look carefully that is was also a Visa card. He then asked if I wanted to pay for my room with that card and once again, I had to remind him to look more carefully to see that it has been prepaid already. Enough said, Finally got my room keys and found out that there was only 1 elevator in the entire building shared with housekeeping. It took a bit before the elevator was available. Finally found my room...a long walk from the elevator and tried to settle in and connect my computer to the net. Their WiFi was non existence. It was not even working properly. so I called the front desk to get someone in the tech department for help, and unlucky me, I got Kevin again. I was informed that the tech guy was out driving the shuttle and won't be back for 30 minutes...???? Huh? Tech guy driving the shuttle???? Kevin suggested that I use the cable to do a direct connection to see if it worked but I could not locate the cable, so he came up and found it hidden in the back of the desk drawer, and it was only 2 feet long! We plugged in the cable and the signal was still weak at best. Once again, the genius said that it was the air conditioner causing the connection problem..!!! Say what????? Needless to say, I told him to excuse himself and have the tech guy call me when he got back...well, in the meantime, I managed to switch somethings around and got better signal. It was almost 8 pm by that time and I was tired....didn't wanna be bothered so I called the front desk and told them not to send anyone up....I really was expecting better service and knowledgeable staff and more than 1 elevator....was disappointed

Reviews.Title: “We all thought this was a quality property with excellent and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: travel47Seattle
Reviews.Content: My six co-workers (from Boston, Seattle and Vermont) and I thought this recently renovated Marriott was a quality property with excellent and friendly service. All the basics were well doneâ€¦ Check-in was easy, the A/C worked well, internet connection was easy, hot water was prompt, plenty of free parking, and the room was clean and quiet. Some extra positives included the larger than usual exercise room and the better than usual dining facility. We all had lunch there one day and the friendly waiter coached us on what was tasty and the best value (buffet vs menu). One of our group commented on how good the food was. The Managerâ€™s reception on Wednesday evening was a hit with complimentary wine, beer, cheese and more. These things are usually tedious events, but the lounge area is modern and nicely furnished. What was really unusual was that the manager was actually there chatting and laughing with guests, enjoying himself and pouring wine! The cash bar and restaurant were also open if you wanted something more. Iâ€™ve stayed at this hotel once in a while over the years. Itâ€™s always been good, but itâ€™s certainly gotten better. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “extremely poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: hbgypsy
Reviews.Content: Its pretty bad when you are right around the corner and the general manager tells you to get back on the freeway and go to downtown SD to get to the hotel.....I had to call another Marriott to direct me to the hotel because the manager didn't know directions. The walls are thin and you can hear people waling around on the level above and the hotel is too far away from everythng. Worst hotel experience I have had in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Internet!”
Reviews.Author: irgrammy
Reviews.Content: I hooked up to their "free" internet service and within one hour I had a virus. When I spoke to the gentleman at the front desk, he assured me they had no internet problems and it was my computer. I didn't have any problems before I got there, but I sure did after I arrived. I lost a day of work and it cost me $400 in time and money to get it fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Marriott property. Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ktown_traveller04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on my way into San Diego. Could not have asked for a better hotel; had a room with two queens and a sofabed. Enormous room with a great balcony. Comfortable beds, clean as a whistle. Quiet location and a great price. Front desk staff when I checked in left a lot to be desired, but maybe working on a Friday night in a tremendous city like San Diego would make the best of us cranky! Overall, this is a top notch Marriott property, and I would stay here again in a heartbeat...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Building - Make sure you see the Vaultâ€¦.”
Reviews.Author: lizzylizlizza
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights in San Diego â€“ arrived very early (having booked early check-in) No rooms were ready, however, the staff managed to find us a room very quickly, was a large room, but very dark, it had one window, which looked onto a wall, so very limited natural light. (Fine for us as we were only there a couple of nights, but any longer, could have been quite depressing). The building had originally been a bank and many of the original features had been retained. The conferencing area was based in the old vault, which still had the old fashioned safety deposit boxes â€“ really worth a look. Liked the free internet â€“ and found the staff helpful, after an initial mix up with our booking, which was eventually sorted out (a friend had booked on our behalf).

Reviews.Title: “Fine Budget Alternative”
Reviews.Author: JanBerlin
Reviews.Content: The hotel (don't let "Central" in the name fool you) lies 10 to 15 minutes by car from San Diego Old Town near a highway in a business area with no shops or restaurants around. Rooms are well appointed, but unfortunately have pretty thin walls. Bedding was nice, breakfast buffet quite good and featured made to order egg dishes. Front desk staff courteous, public areas attractive. Bottom line: if you don't mind the ride into town or want sea views and look for a budget stay near San Diego, go for the Courtyard San Diego Central.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Natdog88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is off the beaten path but close enough to visit San Diego zoo, Seaworld, and San Diego wild animal park. For the price, I was very happy because the hotel was clean and the service was good. David, the maintenance supervisor bent over backwards trying to help me because I couldn't log on to the free wifi. (it turned out that certain rooms did not have a good connection). The hotel is located in a business area so you can avoid the crowds by staying here. The price was good, free parking, free wifi, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Frankly, there are no downsides..”
Reviews.Author: Mashinka
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in Courtyard by Marriott Central in San Diego - very nice hotel. Our room looked and felt new, spacious enough, linens are very fresh and crispy. We had a view on the parking lot and a highway but didn't care too much about , didn't even bother to open the balcony. I'm usually concerned about the sleep quality of the place as i am a very light sleeper - either i was very tired or the hotel was very quiet:) ( they had a football team staying there the night before but, luckily for us, the team was leaving the day we checked in). Shampoo, conditioner, and the face/body soaps in the bathroom - i 'm not familiar with the brand, but good quality. We haven't tried the restaurant but the buffet looked tasty in the morning. Location is not very close to downtown/gaslamp/seaport but close enough - 10 minutes drive took us back to the hotel from the heart of Gaslamp quarter. Unfortunately, didn't have a chance to take a look at the pool too! Overall, definitely coming back - good hotel with very reasonable prices ( we used AAA discount) and convinient location with free parking.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!! Marriott won me over with this one!!”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler212
Reviews.Content: I wasn't a big fan of Marriott hotels. In the past when I stayed there the rooms were old, the buildings were old and outdated, and the service was poor. Well one stay at this hotel and all of that has changed. I even signed up for Marriott Rewards because when I am in the San Diego Area I will be at this hotel. Not even sure where to begin.....how about with the Management. You can tell a good leader when he works the front desk and also drives the hotel van. I wouldn't have known he was the manager. The only way I found out is someone asked. The rooms are awesome. They are comfortable and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the linens nice and crisp. But my favorite part of this hotel is the food. I ordered a Turkey Burger for room service and it was one of the best Turkey burgers that I have ever had. It was well seasoned and just delightful. But the number 1 food experience is the breakfast buffet. The bacon is to die for. I ended up finding out that the Manager special orders the bacon and it's unique to that property. It is delicious..nice and thick and cooked very well. I highly, highly recommend this hotel. I had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mom2Boys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights last week while visiting San Diego. We have two teenaged sons who are too tall to be cramped into a double bed together. It's not always easy to find a hotel with two queen-sized beds. Our room at this Courtyard was perfect with two queen-sized beds, a couch and desk area. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms and hotel were very clean and modern, and there was no noticeable noise from the outside. The only negative thing about the room was that the vanity area was very small and cramped. There was little room on the vanity for us to leave our toiletries and it was too small for two people to be standing in that area. The hotel is located about 10 minutes outside the city center, but right off the highway and easily accessible to town. We prefer staying away from the hustle and bustle, not to mention the added benefits of plenty of free parking, free internet and computers in the business center and less traffic. It was a great location that put us closer to La Jolla and LA without having the downtown traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal!”
Reviews.Author: NehaCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a weekend, while we were in San Diego visiting Sea World. It's about a 15 minutes drive to Seaworld. Very clean and well kept rooms and an overall nice hotel at a decent price. Nothing much hapenning around the neighborhood but great for crashing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- not too far from everything!”
Reviews.Author: SassyGRL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with three generations and extended family. Visited the Wild Animal Park and the San Diego Zoo. Check-in was a breeze and the service here is pretty good. No problems. It was a busy weekend with a lot of youth soccer kids staying for a local game, but the hotel seemed to do a great job accommodating. PARKING/LOCATION: Ample and FREE! That's a big deal in San Diego. I chose this hotel because it is close to San DIego Zoo (about 10 min away) and to a bunch of other things to do in San Diego, but it's away from everything so that you're not having to deal with traffic and crazy parking prices. Take note: The Wild Animal Park is not that close because it's located in Escondido (about 25-30 min away). We were coming from Los Angeles, so we went there first and then to the hotel. Worked out perfectly. The Zoo is better than the Park IMO. ROOM: The room was nicely decorated- pretty modern and new. Bathroom is shower/tub combo. The shower doesn't have much room on the ledge to put your toiletries and stuff. Neither does the sink area. The towels were a little thin and scratchy and the beds were pretty darn uncomfortable. I think it was the pillow. Not really sure, but the sleep quality was pretty low. There's free wireless in the room also and that's a plus. Also a nice big flat screen tv. HOTEL: The pool was hopping and bopping. Lots of people utlizing that. There's a business center with free computer use. The lobby area and lounging area is very cozy and nicely decorated. The breakfast buffet is really nice compared to other hotels. There's omelettes and everything (not just bad continental breakfast stuff). There's also a variety of restaurants near the hotel. Just ask the front to give you the paper with the list of restaurants. Note: There's a bunch of good Japanese places that are actually owned and frequented by Japanese people (that's a good sign). We ate at a Japanese BBQ place that had the best meat ever (even the Yelpers agree). Also, I took a quick glance at the room service menu and it was one of the most reasonable prices for room service food I've ever seen at any hotel. If I were staying longer, I might've tried it! All in all, it was a nice hotel and besides the uncomfy bed, there were no other major problems. Great location and I would recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “All around great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kkroll
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful. Michelle serviced us breakfast every morning with a smile. She and the rest of the staff took very good care of us! I would stay there again! You will need a car if you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: llm2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the weekend of my hubby's funeral. What a beautiful hotel -- everything appeared brand new. Everyone was so wonderful to us. We were in room 338. Lovely eastern facing view, overlooking the swimming pool. At night we sat at the firepit by the pool, sipping our wine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: ReddPupp
Reviews.Content: Recently I had a one night stop over after flight into SD before heading to Palm Springs the next morning. For just one night I'm cheap and usualy stay at EZ8 but this time I decided to use Priceline. This Courtyard was worth twice what I paid for the room. Fantastic beds, quiet, dark, clean, upgraded, great TV, free parking and a block from the freeway made it a fantastic choice and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family”
Reviews.Author: Pricelinejunkie00
Reviews.Content: Traveled with family in the San Diego area to do the typical SD sightseeing trips. The location of the Courtyard Central is perfect to get around the entire area. Pretty much 15-20 minutes to any of the popular destinations. Rooms are very large with a great balcony opened to the pool area. We switched to the Doubletree Del Mar because it's a little closer to Legoland / beach and their pool looked very enticing. Stayed at the exact same AAA rate, but the Courtyard rate included breakfast and wifi. Had to pay extra to get a pool view at the Doubletree (with no balcony) and smaller rooms. We will stay at the Courtyard for the entire trip next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibreak4coffee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard for a week on business. Great location close to the airport and several highways. Couldn't take advantage of the pool and courtyard as it was too cold, but it looked quite nice. Marriott did a good job renovating this hotel and the results are very pleasant for the price. The room I had was spacious and clean even if one of the phone's in the room didn't work and the bathroom was a little worn. But the bed was comfortable and otherwise everything was relatively new. The bar area looked nice but I didnt try it out. There were two things that really stood out for me though - the free wi-fi and the free parking. Having these included in what is already a good rate really improved my impression of the hotel. As a result of policies such as these, I will definitely return to this hotel in the future should I pass through San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for a better location to see San Diego”
Reviews.Author: EDJfromDE
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research on where to stay in the San Diego area that would allow us to see everything from the Zoo to Sea World to LegoLand but minimize the travel time to all. This was our first trip to San Diego, so we canâ€™t compare, but I canâ€™t imagine a more convenient location. We were able to get to San Luis Rey Mission, Oceanside Beach, Sea World, USS Midway, Gas Lamp District, San Diego Wild Animal Park, Coronado Island, LegoLand, La Jolla, and Balboa Park all with less than a 30 minute drive. I can't say enough about how we were treated by the staff. Everyone was VERY pleasant to deal with. The Stay for Breakfast rate was worth every penny ($10 extra for 3 people to get a full hot breakfast buffet including cook to order omelets, Wow!) The Hotel was clean, Room Service was awesome the one time we used it, our room was always clean, the front desk went above and beyond, the pool/hot tub was great. We made this hotel our home for 7 days and it was just that a home.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel with great service and great staff”
Reviews.Author: MONK09
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel. good rooms. good food. really friendly staff Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: FemBusTraveler
Reviews.Content: Always stay at Courtyards for business travel. Loved the new decor and eat-in bar. So many of the Courtyards now do not have a restaurant for dinner. The only downside would be that they have a coffee bar in the morning you have to pay for. No free coffee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “5 miles north of San Deigo saved me $50 per nite!”
Reviews.Author: Thriftybelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new and very clean. Staff is helpful and friendly. I was concerned that I was too far from downtown San Diego and the ocean, but it only took 5 minutes to get to the 8 FWY, which was my central freeway for everything I needed to do. I was very pleased with the location, and was well worth an extra 5 mile drive to save $50/night over hotels closer to San Diego. And as an added bonus, they don't charge a parking fee...many San Diego hotels charge upwards of $22/day in addition to their room rate! Only negative was that the A/C was a little noisy when it kicked on and off....but may have just been my room. Was not severe enough to complain. Have no other complaint at all...was a great stay! Oh, and the pool...very nice! I relaxed by the beautiful gas fire pit...very high end!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, roomy, and great service”
Reviews.Author: TRLINN
Reviews.Content: With three kids in tow--9, 5, and 2 year olds, we needed a room with space without going overbudget. Our two-bed room was spacious, clean with non of that typical smell you would get at cheap inns or motels, and it got modern decor. The check-in clerk was not notified that we were to get complimentary breakfast for 2 adult and 2 children during our stay, but gave it to us when I showed her my confirmation email from Orbitz. Our stay was very pleasant and I haven't been this comfortable in a hotel room for a long time...even when I had paid more.

Reviews.Title: “Where Did All The Kids Come From??”
Reviews.Author: Crewguy
Reviews.Content: I booked the Courtyard because of the Marriott reputation and because it's typically a business traveler's hotel, so I thought it would be relatively quiet. The hotel is very nice, it had a warm, inviting open check-in area with a sit down eatery, business area, sitting area with fireplace, coffee shop, etc. The check-in staff were very friendly and efficient; however, they had difficulty understanding that because there were 3 of us in the room, we needed an extra chair to sit in. We were promised an extra chair, but it never materialized (no big deal, it just would have been nice). The rooms were very big, with plenty of room for us to spread out. The bathroom was typical - with the vanity outside of the actual shower area - which is nice when there are multiple occupants. The room had a balcony which overlooked the pool/jacuzzi area. The hotel has a very large pool which we didn't take advantage of. The only drawback (and it wasn't that big of an issue) was the fact that there seemed to be more families and teenagers at this hotel than there were business travelers which made for a little more noise than you would normally find at a hotel such as this. The hotel was located very conveniently to everything we needed to do. It's situated in a business area, but there are multiple restaurants within a close driving proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stress Free Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sdbtrflygrl
Reviews.Content: We stay in San Diego often and this is one of our favorite hotels. We usually stay in 4-5 star hotels and have not been impressed with the lower star offerings in San Diego. This hotel is one that stands out in it's class! The rooms are recently renovated with modern furnishings that are relaxing and perfect for a vacation or business trip. Our room was big! A large desk, couch (sitting area) and king sized bed. The TV was a flat screen. The bathroom was large too. The best part of the room was we had a large balcony! Great to bring in the nice San Diego outdoors. The only complaint would be that the bathroom sink area is small and only has one sink. For everything else this hotel offers this was a small inconvenience and not one that made a big impact. The hotel lobby is fresh, modern and upbeat and has a cute looking restaurant and bar area (we didn't eat there). There is lots of free parking right in front of the hotel which is great! The hotel was quiet and the hotel staff was really friendly and accomidating. Ask for a balcony room! We would definitely stay here again! Great modern rooms and a comfortable hotel that is centrally located. Close to La Jolla, Downtown, the beach and all major freeways!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel just a short drive from Sea World”
Reviews.Author: azmommyto3
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights during our vacation to Sea World. Its a 10-15 minute drive from the hotel to the park, but well worth it. And if you have a GPS system, its a breeze! The hotel staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful! We arrived very early, at 11am, and we were given a room right away, even though check in wasn't until 3pm. This allowed us to drop off our things and head to Sea World right away. The parking lot was great! Tons of room for parking, we were able to park directly in front of our room every night, there was no struggling to find a spot like we've had to at other hotels. The room itself was just right- comfy beds and pillows, extremely clean bathroom. The hotel is in somewhat of an industrial area, but thats what made it so nice, no traffic around the area on the weekend, because those offices were closed. There are plenty of little restaurants and fast food places to eat within a mile of the hotel. A nice little McDonalds around the corner that had $.79 cheeseburgers and $.99 extra large drinks, which was very nice since we were traveling with kids, it made for a cheap fast meal. All in all, we will definitely stay at this hotel the next time we come ( which will be often, since we bought year long Sea World passes) :)

Reviews.Title: “Full Service Courtyard - Kind of Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Picky_Picky111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convenient to my meeting, but otherwise the location is nothing special. It is in an office/industrial area. There were some restaurants nearby. I ate dinner at the restaurant at the hotel and it was quite good. My room was a typical Courtyard room. Drawbacks were that the sink area is really small and the room was noisy from the nearby expressway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: usmcwifey
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel and most Marriott's we stay in. This is a very nice , modern, clean hotel. They have a Starbucks inside, nice fitness area, wonderful heated pool and spa, along with a bar and room service restaurant that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner ! The only issue i had was the regular rooms are on the small side, but the out of this world comfy bed made up for it ! I highly reccomend this hotel. it is in a safe and nice area close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: rablab
Reviews.Content: Good stay. Very good front desk staff, very helpful. Otherwise a typical Courtyard. The Courtyards are usually uniform in appearance, quality and amenities. This one was no different. Good solid hotel. The location was just OK, although San Diego is fairly easy to get around on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Ended up being great”
Reviews.Author: suru
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter who was not feeling well and I stayed for a Saturday night at this hotel and when we finally got there we were exhausted and cranky after an extremely long and tiring day and just wanted a quiet room to wind down in. We had never stayed here before, but Marriotts have always been good bets for us in the past. When we arrived about 10:00PM to check in there was at least 20 people standing in the lobby right by the front desk talking so loudly I couldn't even hear the man at the front desk. I had to yell my name to him a few times before he heard me. Our whole conversation consisted of yelling back and forth. The bar/lounge area was packed and just as noisy. I thought to myself, "What did we get ourselves into!" Well, I needn't have worried because the hotel turned out to be very nice. Check in went smoothly and quickly (despite the yelling) and we proceeded to our room. The hotel was booked solid and the only room they had left was a 3rd floor king room meant for a business traveler. It was a little small, but it was fine for one or two people. I looked at the map of the hotel and I noticed that there are larger rooms available, we just ended up with the smallest type which worked out for the two of us, but I think it might be tight for a family. The bed was comfy and there was a small couch and a coffee table and a good sized desk with free wireless internet connection. The sink area in the bathroom was a little small and only one person at a time could use it. The toilet and shower were separate which was nice. The towels were nice and fluffy and there were a lot of them. The entire room was very clean. The nicest thing about the room was that it overlooked the beautifully landscaped and huge pool and patio area. Most of the rooms in the hotel had balconies. Since my daughter was sick and needed to stay in bed as long as possible, I asked for a 1:00PM check out which they happily provided. It was nice to sit out on the patio and watch families playing in the pool. The hotel also had a very nice fitness center. There were 3 really nice treadmills, 2 stairsteppers, and 3 bikes. There were also 4-5 weight machines. What was nice is the treadmills looked out floor to ceiling windows to the beautiful patio and pool area. We ate breakfast at the restuarant and they had an all you can eat buffet for $12.50. They had everything you could possible want for breakfast included a cook who would make you a made to order omelette. The service was excellent and the food tasty. Whoever the loud partiers were the night before must have left very early Sunday as by 10:00AM the hotel was almost deserted and there were very few guests left. I had a some time to enjoy the property since we didn't have to leave until 1:00 and all of the staff I encountered were very nice and friendly. In addition to the restaurant, there is a bar and a little counter that sells drinks, fruit, snacks, and I think Starbucks. The Starbucks was closed when I was walking around. The hotel is right in the middle of an office park area and I didn't see any restuarants or stores close by so it was nice they had the little store and a restaurant on site. I was really worried when we got here, but the hotel ended up being very nice and relaxing and I have booked another stay there in May.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here often - good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: User73
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than a dozen times in the past two years while on business. If you need a standard hotel in the area, this hotel is clean and well-run. The breakfast buffet (not included in most room rates) is quite good, the exercise room is nicer than average, and the free high-speed internet always works. There are not a lot of fancy restaurants nearby, but there are a number of casual establishments within a few minutes drive. My only complaint...despite having stayed there so many times, on check-in they always ask me if this is my first visit to the property. Not a big deal, but amusing nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation base”
Reviews.Author: chuckawala
Reviews.Content: Our family chose this spot for 4th of July week. Since it was a newer hotel and a good spot to reach the attractions in SD county, we really enjoyed it. The airport, beaches, fairgrounds and zoo were only 10-20 minutes away. The pool was nice and the area is in an office park/residential zone off the freeway, but quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: rshu330
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The frontdesk staff was nice, and the room met my expectations. No complaints or problems whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Surferleo
Reviews.Content: When I could not get into my usual hotel, I booked the Courtyard Marriott. I booked thru their own website and the rate was cheaper than all the on line travel websites. Since I grew up not far from this hotel, I knew what to expect as far as location. It is not a far drive to anything in San Diego if you know where you are headed. Originally, I was given a ground floor room which shared a wall with the ice machine. Big mistake! I am a light sleeper and the noisy machine kept me awake all night. To my surprise and delight, the front desk staff was very understanding and were able to move me to a much quieter 3rd floor room. Their treatment proved to be indicative of my entire 8 day experience. Everyone was very helpful and accomodating. I complimented the manager on her well trained and friendly staff. This does seem to be a hotel for visiting high school sports teams. There were at least 3 large teams there during my stay, however they were very well behaved and supervised. I would recommend this hotel to all travelers. It was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for quiet...look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: centralvalleymember
Reviews.Content: Booked this property because it was new, had good reviews on TripAdvisor, a decent location, and a reasonable price. Specifically requested a top-floor, courtyard-facing room in a quiet location more than two months in advance. Arrived promptly at check-in time to find there were only two top-floor rooms available - one faced the freeway, the other had been smoked in â€“ and this is a 100% non-smoking hotel. Assured that it was a quiet location, we settled for a first floor room at the end of the hall. It turned out to be next to a stairwell that exited to the pool, and we were treated to dozens (hundreds?) of young people thundering up and down the stairs and slamming doors until at least one a.m. (Apparently there were several busloads of high school band members staying that weekend!) The folks above us seemed to be moving furniture and dropping barbells on the floor until the wee hours, as well. The next morning at breakfast, our server noticed that we were not too happy with our stay thus far, and tried her best to do get management to comp our breakfast, they WOULD NOT. She went above and beyond and got our breakfast taken care of through other means: this was the one bright spot in an otherwise miserable experience. We promptly packed our bags and checked into another hotel. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Clean Hotel But Not Where You Want To Be For A Sightseeing Trip”
Reviews.Author: MissPicante
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over Thanksgiving while we were visiting our son who has a small apartment nearby. It was the cleanest property I've ever visited. The staff was cheerful and helpful. The hotel is so well-maintained that I asked if it was new-it's been open four years. We had a good rate ($135) because we were there for a week. As other reviewers have noted, this hotel is in the middle of a large area of office buildings and very obviously caters to business people during the week and special events (we saw people there for a soccer tournament) over the weekend. There is absolutely nothing nearby within walking or easy driving distance in the way of restaurants, retail, nightlife, ect. Not the hotel's fault, of course, but something you need to know before booking. So unless you're there for nearby family or business, you'll want to stay somewhere else. It's just not where you want to be for sightseeing or sports in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: dmlee90
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from San Diego and we had a wonderful stay at the Courtyard San Diego Central. Our room was very clean, spacious, comfortable beds, and very good customer service. Our room came with a complimentary breakfast buffet (the Stay for Breakfast Promotion) which was also very good. I would recommend this hotel to families. Not too many attractions close by, but located in a nice area.....business district with lots of restaurants around. Also close to the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Obscure Location”
Reviews.Author: ttchamps
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for the Packers/Chargers preseason game and for a day at the beach. Paid only $112 a nite on priceline when the 1-star hotels in the Hotel Cirlce area were going for $125 a night and higher. Was well worth the price, clean room and very comfortable beds. I regret not bringing the laptop since they had the free high spped internet in each room. The dining options on site seemed pricey but was not a concern of mine since I did not eat here. Overall I liked the place but was in the middle of a industrial park, which made it hard to find at first and also more expensive than I thought it would be to get to and from the stadium via taxi. Would probably go back here again if I paid the same price for this place, but the location of the property is somewhat of a drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price -great location next to Oldtown”
Reviews.Author: Bgiannam
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first stop on a 10 day California trip. We booked this hotel after reading the good reviews others had given on trip advisor. Rooms were small yet clean. Because we had reserved a non-smoking room, when we arrived, the only non-smoking room that was left was the handicapped accessible room. We took it to avoid the smoke smell. Not the best idea. The shower was difficult to use at best. No lip around the stall meant water everywhere on the bathroom floor, and you had to hand hold the nozzle....try that while lathering or shampooing!! However, as I said this was our choice and no reflection of the hotel. The breakfast buffet was $10 and easily worth it. The only complaint we had, was the pool area. It is VERY small, and while we were staying there, a group of girls softball teams were staying there. They would come in from the games and jump into the pool fully dressed in their dirty uniforms, and no one stopped them. Again, I am sure this was unique to our stay, but the pool is a glorified 'kiddie' pool in size. Overall, we were happy with the location, walking distance to Oldtown, and a safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ask for a King Suite or you will be up all night.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Asked for a king suite, received room 276. Come to find out, all King suites are located next to the vending/ice machine and you can hear the loud motors and the ice dropping when people obtain ice. Suggestions for the hotel: Sound insulate vending room Make other rooms/locations for King suite Front desk couldn't move us, had to speak to a manager. Manager left a message for us at 1pm in our room (we left our cell number). He said he could work something out but we came back in at 9pm and too tired to move everything.

Reviews.Title: “Cant go wrong here !! worth every penny !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Courtyard Marriott . All I can say is it was worth every penny . I thought the rooms were a decent size , very very clean , very nice in general . Solid walls , so you didnt hear anything else going on next store , or in the hall. The bathroom was very large for a hotel , not to mention the shower was very soothing . The Bed ???? geeeeeeeesh was it every comfortable . The only other time I have stayed in a bed this comfortable was in the Hyatt Regency in Maui ( but that cost me 325.00 a night ) I fell asleep every night before 10 which is unreal for me , but the bed was so comfortable I couldnt help it . They have a great buffet in the morning for breaksfast . Quite a spread they put on . I am talking waffles , eggs , omeletes , ham , sausage , bacon , fruts , yogurts , toasts , bagels , everything you can think of . I cant possibly think of a single bad thing to say about my stay at the Courtyard . From the minute I walked in , until the minute I left it was truly a pleasure being there . If you are caught in between a list of hotels to stay in while visiting San Diego , take my word on it that the Courtyard Marriott is a no brainer !!! for about 100 a night good luck trying to find something better . Absolute slam dunk !!!! And believe me I travel a lot , and I dont give good reviews to just any hotel.......

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff C
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this facility for 4 nights and had a great stay. The hotel is very clean and being in a bussiness park, it was very quiet. Since we had 5 in the room the front desk clerk got us a bigger room that would accomadate a roll away bed. We asked for extra towels the first day and they remembered this throughout our stay. Dinning and 2 coffee houses were within 1/2 mile. Close to the 15 so you can get anywhere quick, depending on the time of day that is. Only negative was the shower as it was not very powerful. We would stay in this hotel again. Jeff

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard San Diego Central in late June, and found it to be excellent. The front desk staff were very helpful and professional. Rooms were very clean and modern. The location is right near Hwy 163, so don't expect any spectacular views, but the rooms are well sound proofed. The location made for very easy access to Old Town and the Zoo, taking less than 10 minutes. The pool area is actually quite good. Attractive surroundings and a good size pool. Breakfast in the restaurant was not cheap but there was a great selection from the buffet. I can't believe this hotel is rated only 86 out of 200. I think the other reviewers were tough graders.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and it was easy to get to all of San Diego's attractions. The hotel is right off highway 163. It was easy to drive to La Jolla, Old Towne, San Diego Wild Animal Park, etc. There was abundant parking and there was a lot of fast food options in the area. However, there were no other hotels around and it is in a business-park area. The pool was nice. I never ate at the hotel. The last day I found out that there was free internet access in the business room, which was great. The room was nice but there was a view of the parking lot. Overall a decent place to stay--I stayed for $129/night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenyonsf
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 4 nights here. Located about 15 minutes north of downtown, 5 minutes north of Hotel Circle, this Courtyard faces the freeway. Cheaper than sometimes-expensive downtown hotels and not too far out of the city, it was close to major freeways, restaurants and shopping. Check-in service was very good - they were sold out but accomodated my early check-in and even gave me two choices of room. The hotel generally looks recently renovated with new carpets. There are laundry facilities which are well kept. There is a restaurant with a large breakfast buffet for $10. The rooms could use some improvement. The shower heads and matresses could stand replacing but weren't awful. Room was large with good sized furniture. If you want a decent-sized balcony that doesn't face the freeway, ask for rooms facing the pool.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Courtyard's!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Courtyard's and this one is right up there with the best of them. The exercise room is outstanding, equipment is newer and a wide selection. The service at the hotel lobby is very good, lots of parking available, the breakfast is typical Courtyard fare and good. The room was very clean with a nice desk, couch and coffee table. I thought that the view of the Miramar Air Base was cool although some might not like the idea of F-18's flying touch & go's all day! It's a short drive to La Jolla for dinner without the high price of La Jolla hotels. I'll stay here again if I go back to San Diego. It also has a full bar and a Starbuck's in the lobby - good stuff! The price was very reasonable for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the summer during trip to SD. Compared to the previous user, I found the bed very comfortable. Easy freeway access made travel simple. Great hotel with a great rate.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard San Diego Central
HotelInfo.Address: 8651 Spectrum Center Blvd, San Diego, CA 92123
